utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE JOHN RAGLAN
utterance.content: Detective Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: RAGLAN
utterance.content: This is John Raglan. I was the lead investigator on your mother’s homicide twelve years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I remember you, Detective Raglan.

utterance.speaker: RAGLAN
utterance.content: Listen, I... We need to talk about your mother’s case. There’s something you don’t know. There’s a coffee shop at Fourth and Main. Meet me there in an hour. Just you, no cops.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can we talk for a second?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s him.

utterance.speaker: RAGLAN
utterance.content: Lady, what part of "no cops" didn’t you understand?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s not a cop.

utterance.speaker: RAGLAN
utterance.content: Well who the hell is he then?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s someone I trust.

utterance.speaker: WAITRESS
utterance.content: More coffee?

utterance.speaker: RAGLAN
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tell me what I don’t know about my mom’s murder.

utterance.speaker: RAGLAN
utterance.content: Everybody drinks their coffee out of cardboard cups these day. Or those plastic travel mugs, but there’s something about the way ceramic warms your hands that… It’s weird, the things you notice. I just got the long face from the doc. Lymphoma. Six months.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sorry to hear about that.

utterance.speaker: RAGLAN
utterance.content: Every year around the holidays they, they run that Christmas Carol on local TV. When I was a kid I remember that Jacob Marley scared the hell out of me. Forced to drag that, that chain around in the next world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: "I wear the chain I forged in life."

utterance.speaker: RAGLAN
utterance.content: "I made it link by link." I hid a lot of sins behind my badge, and now I gotta carry 'em. But your mother’s case, that one weighs a ton.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why? Because you wrote it off as random gang violence when you knew it wasn’t?

utterance.speaker: RAGLAN
utterance.content: I did what I was told. And I kept quiet because I was afraid. About a year ago there was a hostage standoff at your precinct. You killed a hit man named Dick Coonan. It was a big deal in the papers. People noticed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who hired Coonan to kill my mom?

utterance.speaker: RAGLAN
utterance.content: You need some context here. This thing started about nineteen years ago, back before I even knew who Johanna Beckett was. Nineteen years ago I made a bad mistake. And that started the dominoes falling, and one of them was your mother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Everybody on the ground, now. Back away from the window, away from the window.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re hit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m fine, it’s not my blood. One Lincoln Forty, I have shots fired on Fourth and Main. I need backup and an ambulance.

utterance.speaker: DISPATCH
utterance.content: One Lincoln Forty, repeat your last transmission, you’re broken One Lincoln Forty, repeat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: DISPATCH
utterance.content: Dispatch to One Lincoln Forty, repeat. Dispatch to One Lincoln Forty, One Lincoln Forty, are you there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: One Lincoln Forty, please be advised this is now a homicide.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN ROY MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Retired NYPD cop gunned down in front of one of my people, which means I’m gonna have to do a damn press conference. Tell me you didn’t come down here without backup?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I…

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: We were backing her, Captain.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah we were uh, just down the block when it happened.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Yeah, uh huh. The hell am I gonna do with you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re gonna let me work this case.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You’re too close to it, it’s all over your face. You’re thinking, what was Raglan going to tell me before he died? When you should be thinking how you're gonna catch the guy that killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir. Raglan was killed because he was going to tell me something about my mother’s case. Nobody knows it better than I do.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Yeah, but I know you. You’re gonna want to pick up those scissors and run around the house with them. But I’m telling you now, walk, don’t run. Go where the evidence leads, not the other way round. Do you read me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, sir. Loud and clear.

utterance.speaker: CRIME SCENE TECH
utterance.content: Found a bullet embedded in the booth. Three three eight Magnum, fairly exotic anti-personnel round.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you show me the trajectory?

utterance.speaker: CRIME SCENE TECH
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s right over here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. I make the building across the street, fourth floor. Esposito?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah I’ll lock it down. Somebody had to've seen something in there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, I am betting that Raglan’s murderer followed him here, can you check with his neighbors? See if anyone was hanging around his place this morning?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks. Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You good?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I think I got it all off my hands.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s different when it happens right in front of you. Close enough to watch the lights go out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. When I saw the blood on your shirt I thought you’d been shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um. I’m gonna go to the Twelfth. How ‘bout I drop you off, your place?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not a chance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. So I checked out the fourth floor. There’s no prints, no casings, no witnesses, but the good news is, it’s a secure building. The only way in or out is through the lobby. Nobody gets through the lobby turnstiles without a key card.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So our shooter had a card?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, they’re sending over list of all their employees. We’re also downloading surveillance video from the lobby.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So I, ah, talked to the neighbors. Raglan was a widower, no next of kin that I could find. Super said he didn’t really have visitors. Except every once in a while his buddy would come over and watch a Yankee game. Gary McCallister, Raglan’s old academy classmate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get a hold of McCallister, see if he’ll come in. I wanna talk to him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nineteen years ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Raglan started telling us something that happened nineteen years ago. My mom’s murder was twelve years ago, it’s not making any sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When was the last time you saw John Raglan?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What else did he tell you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Raglan was helping me with a, uh, cold case that I was working on. I believe he was killed to keep him quiet. Look, Raglan seemed to think the case had something to do with something he did nineteen years ago. What was he into back then?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not trying to tarnish Raglan’s memory. I’m trying to find his murderer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With who?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Vulcan Simmons?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He runs half the drug trade in New York.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then he wasn’t?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Assault, attempted murder, extortion, possession with intent, witness intimidation. It looks like it just dries up. Nobody’s booked him in years.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what does that mean, he found religion?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Means he got smart. Swimming in deeper waters.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Guess he’s come a long way since Washington Heights.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, what? You said Washington Heights?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Back in the day Simmons used to run the drug trade in Washington Heights.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My mom and a group of her colleagues, they put together this campaign called 'Take Back the Neighborhood.' They were trying to get drug dealers off the streets in Washington Heights.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: With Simmons running all the dope in that neighborhood, that campaign would have cost him. That hit man Coonan, we know that he was into dope, maybe that’s how Simmons got in contact with him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Simmons hires Coonan to kill them all, including your mother, and pays his old friend Raglan to write off their homicides as random gang violence. There would have been no way to trace the murders back to him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Until Raglan threatens to reveal his role in the conspiracy and Simmons has him silenced.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll have him in the box before lunch.

utterance.speaker: VULCAN SIMMONS
utterance.content: They’ve painted since I was last in here. You’d have been about sixteen, wrestling some pimply kid in the back of his daddy’s wagon. Wondering if you were going to give it to him or not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, that’s enough.

utterance.speaker: SIMMONS
utterance.content: He’s sweet on you, makes him brave.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was your association with Detective John Raglan?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There is no statute of limitations on murder, Mr Simmons.

utterance.speaker: SIMMONS
utterance.content: And here begins what is known as the initial confrontation. During this phase of the interrogation, the interrogator may invade the suspect's personal space in order to increase his discomfort. You want to invade my personal space?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look at me. Twelve years ago Johanna Beckett led a big 'take back the neighborhood' campaign in Washington Heights.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that must have pissed you off.

utterance.speaker: SIMMONS
utterance.content: And this would be theme development. Presenting the crime through the eyes of a suspect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Johanna Beckett was murdered, along with two of her colleagues. They were professional hits carried out on your orders, and you had your pet homicide detective John Raglan bury them. Look at her face. Tell me you don’t remember her.

utterance.speaker: SIMMONS
utterance.content: You know, Detective Beckett, I think I do remember her. Bled out in an alley like the trash she was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Simmons, you better watch…

utterance.speaker: SIMMONS
utterance.content: Rich ***** from uptown on safari in the Heights. Somebody should have warned her not to feed or tease the animals.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You…

utterance.speaker: SIMMONS
utterance.content: If they had she might not have gotten eaten. From what I hear though, huh, she was pretty tasty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa - Beckett…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Back off, Castle. Remember your old life, Vulcan…

utterance.speaker: SIMMONS
utterance.content: Huh...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Savor it, because I am going to take it all away.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Stand down.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett, that’s enough.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Stand down.

utterance.speaker: SIMMONS
utterance.content: Oh you want some too? Come on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s enough.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I have to kick that son of a ***** loose now, you realise that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, you heard him, he as much as confessed to the murder.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Come on, he was playing you. And you let him get under your skin, acting like a damn rookie. We’ve got nothing to tie him to Raglan’s murder or to your mother's. You’re off this case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No sir, you can’t do that, not now.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I just did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I just did. Now you go home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett. Kate.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You too, Castle, clear out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did I do?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I don’t need you playing Nancy Drew on this. As of this moment you two are running point on Raglan’s homicide.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ah, Captain, my partner and I don’t wish to be insubordinate…

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’ll respectfully decline the assignment.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: What does it say on my badge?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Captain.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Now read the fine print. It says get your ass out there and solve Raglan’s murder before I bust you both back down to traffic.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You wanna help her? Find that shooter, solve the damn case.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: What if it had been you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t know you were home.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I heard about the shooting on the news. It could have been you, you know that, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but I’m fine, it wasn’t me.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard, this isn’t one of your books. You don’t know the ending, you were just lucky yesterday.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re overreacting, Mother. Where is this coming from?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: How the hell can you ask me something like that? Think about how much you love Alexis, and that is how much I love you, and don’t you dare ask me where this is coming from. You have gotten through most of your life on your wit and charm and no small amount of talent, but that is the real world out there. And you can’t charm your way out of a bullet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think I should quit?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I think you should be honest with yourself about why you are doing this. You have written twenty-two novels before you met her and you didn’t need to spend every day at a police station in order to finish them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not about the books any more.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you think Simmons hired the sniper?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Find the sniper, we can ask him. I figured he’d have to disassemble his rifle, right? Break his weapon down to a less conspicuous shape in order to get it through the lobby, something fit inside of a briefcase.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Everyone in that lobby is carrying a damn briefcase.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh, you should be a detective. We can’t come up empty on this one.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I know, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, that wasn’t an accident.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He just lifted her key card. So much for the card telling us who the sniper was.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait a minute… he’s not wearing gloves.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So what? He didn’t touch any printable surfaces.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah but he touched her. We can print a dead body, right? So why can’t we print a live one?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s probably showered by now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not necessarily, it’s Saturday, it’s barely afternoon. Come on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Where’s Josh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, he’s in Africa, he’s saving the world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ahhh, I brought you some…I just thought, after everything that… you might want… here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. That’s really sweet. You wanna come in?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sure. Wow, nice. You know, I was thinking on the way over here. All the best cops, Dirty Harry, Cobra, guy from Police Academy who makes the helicopter noises. They all have one thing in common.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Plucky sidekick?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That and they do their very best work after they’ve been booted off a case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that what you came all the way over here to tell me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Montgomery booted us off the Raglan murder, but he didn’t say anything about your mother's case, did he? Here’s my plan… I sneak back into the station, wearing a hat. Montgomery always takes a coffee break fifteen minutes after the hour. I get your mother’s file, wearing soft shoes, the south entrance … what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on Castle, I’ve gotta show you something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know sometimes I forget you live with this every day. Josh know about this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When did you start?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Over the summer, when you were in the Hamptons.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And how far have you gotten?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, aside from my mom, there was also Diane Cavanaugh, Jennifer Stewart. They volunteered for her from time to time for the justice initiative, and the fourth victim was Scott Murray. He was a document clerk at the court house. You know, Castle, up until today I’d always run this with the theory that they got killed because of a legal case they were working on. My mom requested a court file just before she was murdered. And that file went missing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, your mom must have had personal papers? Appointment book? Something that could tell you what she was working on before she died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I went through all of that nine years ago, there’s nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, well, a lot's happened since then. Maybe you missed something?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: TECH GUY
utterance.content: Looks like we got a lift.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s nothing in her appointment book, not that I can make sense of anyway. She had her own system, my dad and I could never figure it out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ahhh, you were adorable. Did your mom take these?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, about three weeks before she died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Trust me, Castle, it was not pretty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, now I have to see it. Hmmmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh… there’s twenty-four exposures on this roll and there’s only twenty pictures.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An empty street?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, this is where my mom was murdered. I don’t understand, I mean these pictures were developed a week before she was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would she be taking photos of that alley?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I dunno, I always just thought it was just a convenient place for the killer to attack. I mean it was dark, it was secluded…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if there is more to it than that? What if she was looking into something that happened in that alley when they killed her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I’d have to go into the old archives and reports, and Captain Montgomery won’t let me back in the precinct right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hal Lockwood. Male, white, thirty two. Record’s clean. According to this Lockwood’s never had as much as a traffic citation. Credit history only goes back about two years.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Gotta be a cover ID.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh, his credit card's active. Shows Lockwood checked into a corporate suite in midtown right now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Clear. Looks like we just missed him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Look at this. He’s been watching her.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Ryan and Esposito traced your sniper to a corporate suite in midtown. He’s been on you since Raglan’s murder. This isn’t just a kook with a deer rifle and a copy of Catcher in the Rye. This guy’s a professional, highly trained and well funded, maybe part of a team.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, we gotta let Castle know.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: He does. He’s back at the Twelfth; I caught him in the men’s room poking through some old reports. You want to tell me about that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You really wanna know?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Listen, I’m going to have to put a detail on you. But I need you to stay home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This sniper is after me, the safest place in the city is the Twelfth. You gotta let me have this, Roy. Let me come back and work on my mom’s case.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: No. I’m sorry. Absolutely not.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: CSU analyzed the capsules we found in Lockwood’s suite. Found they contain a highly concentrated form of an anti-anxiety drug called Prozapam.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That fits. A good sniper fires between heartbeats. Magnum Special Forces, some of the guys would use anti-anxiety meds to slow down their heart rate, gives them more time to shoot.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: These didn’t come from any commercial lab. They were hand ground by someone on the street, someone very good with chemicals.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Someone like Vulcan Simmons.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I thought the same thing, but check this out. Dealers sometimes use symbols like these to mark their product. These symbols don’t belong to Simmons, they’re the brand of a street pharmacist in SoHo named Chad Rodrick.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Chad Rodrick. You must be one lucky guy. You’ve been arrested for possession of pseudophedrine, possession of forged triplicate prescriptions, and the manufacture of a controlled substance. But never convicted.

utterance.speaker: CHAD RODRICK
utterance.content: Those are all misunderstandings. I’m just a college student... with my father's lawyer on speed dial.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know why you’re here?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: No, but I’m going to guess it has something to do with class resentment. I bet it’s a special treat for you to interrogate above your station.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’re here because you sold these to him. But we're not dope cops, Chad, so these we don’t care about. Him, we want.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: I’m afraid I can’t help you. You guys can’t arrest me, you don’t have proof of anything.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, we’re not going to arrest you Chad, we’re just going to detain you for a while, in lockup.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, we’ve got a parolee in there. Sex offender. Six one, couple of bills and change. They call him 'Peppermint.' And he’d just love to meet a handsome young man of your station.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We know you sold custom blend Prozapam which is a controlled substance, but we’re running a special today. All we want to know is where we can find him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or… you can go to lockup and meet your new friend.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Listen. I sold those two weeks ago, but not to him. I’ve never seen this guy before in my life.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who brought the pills?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Jolene. She’s one of my regulars.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tell me about her.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Blonde, thirties, I think she lives somewhere in Brooklyn.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Last name.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: I don’t know. She just shows up when she wants something. I swear, I don’t even know how to get hold of her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You talked to Montgomery?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Castle, there’s something I need you to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Name it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Go home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Forget it. 'Fear does not exist in this dojo'.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I signed up for this when I put that badge on, you didn’t. It’s not your fight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The hell it isn’t. I don’t hang around you just to annoy you. I don’t ride up to murder scenes in the middle of the night to satisfy some morbid curiosity. If that’s all this was, then I would have quit a long time ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why do you keep coming back, Rick?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, I may not have a badge - unless you count the chocolate one Alexis gave me for my birthday - but I’ll tell you this. Like it or not, I’m your plucky sidekick.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Plucky sidekick always gets killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Partner, then.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: OK. What’d you find?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You remember what Raglan said back at the coffee shop about this thing going back nineteen years?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Turns out before your mother, there was another murder in this alley, back when it was the back entrance to a club called Sons of Palermo. It was an old Mafia hang out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I didn’t know this was a club.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it got shut down years before your mother was killed, after an FBI agent by the name of Bob Armund was killed in the alley behind it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It says Armund was working undercover in the Mafia.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Somehow the mob got onto Armund, used the old family remedy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Summary execution.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: NYPD arrested a mob enforcer for Armund’s murder, a guy by the name of Joe Pulgatti. He later pled guilty, and guess who the arresting officer was?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Officer John Raglan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your mother was a civil rights attorney, did she ever mention Armund’s murder or Pulgatti’s conviction?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nope, but there’s got to be a connection somewhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bet Pulgatti could shed some light on it.

utterance.speaker: JOE PULGATTI
utterance.content: I didn’t kill Bobby Armund.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why did you plead guilty?

utterance.speaker: PULGATTI
utterance.content: Cause I don’t like needles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detective Raglan places you in the alley at the time of the murder.

utterance.speaker: PULGATTI
utterance.content: Yeah, I was in that alley with Bobby. I was the only witness to his murder. But it wasn’t a hit. It was a kidnapping that went sideways. Three guys in ski masks rolled up in a van, said they wanted to take me on a tour of the city. Bobby tried to stop them, went for one of their guns, he wound up on the wrong end of it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Were they guys from a rival family?

utterance.speaker: PULGATTI
utterance.content: No, no way. We had a truce going back then, because there was this ghost runner up there -- professional kidnappers targeting members of all five families. Look, I was in that alley with Bobby, but no-one else could have known that. It was a blind alley, and the only other people in it when Bobby was shot were the people who shot him. So you tell me detective, how could Raglan have known I was there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re saying Raglan was one of the kidnappers?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There was a lawyer named Johanna Beckett, are you familiar with her? She was murdered in the alley about seven years into your incarceration.

utterance.speaker: PULGATTI
utterance.content: You look just like her, you know. When I first walked in here, it was like I was looking at a ghost. The way she talked about you, I should have known you’d become a cop. I sent letters to every lawyer I could find and your mother was the only one who wrote me back. The only one willing to take a chance on me. She didn’t care that I was a thug.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All she cared about was the truth.

utterance.speaker: PULGATTI
utterance.content: She came to visit me here, she said she’d look into my case. Later I found out she was murdered. Don’t get yourself killed chasing this thing. Take it from me, there’s nothing more dangerous out there than a killer with a badge.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: We’ll talk about the definition of a direct order later. Right now I just want to hear what you’ve found.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: OK, so here’s what we know so far. Nineteen years ago Raglan and at least two other cops were kidnapping mobsters for ransom. Things went south when they tried to snatch Joe Pulgatti.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They mistakenly killed an undercover Fed named Bob Armund. To cover their asses they pinned Armund’s murder on Pulgatti.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then, seven years later, my mom and a group of her colleagues tried to put together an appeal for Pulgatti. Now the cops knew that if the case got overturned they would all be exposed. So they hired Dick Coonan to kill all of them.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: And Raglan wrote off their homicides as random gang violence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that would have been the end of it, but Raglan found out he was dying, said he wanted to come clean. So they had to silence him too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pulgatti said that there were three kidnappers in that van, that means there’s at least two conspirators out there now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And we already know who one of them is, Raglan’s old academy buddy Gary McCallister.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: How do you know that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I pulled the dispatchers' log from the archives. There was another unit backing Raglan when he arrested Pulgatti. A one man patrol unit, Officer Gary McCallister.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Get that son of a *****.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Vulcan Simmons had nothing to do with this, but as a former cop you knew that he’d fit the part, and so you used him to throw us off when the truth is that you and Raglan were up to your necks in murder and kidnappings.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then you did plenty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kidnapping, cover ups.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You killed a Fed and then you pinned it on Pulgatti.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kidnapping people for ransom was right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When my mom put together that appeal for Pulgatti, you got worried that she’d get onto you, so you hired Dick Coonan to kill her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then when Raglan grew a conscience you had him killed too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s afraid of someone and it’s not a cop. We’ve got to find that shooter.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think we’ve got a lead on him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: According to Rodrick a woman named Jolene bought those capsules we found in Lockwood’s corporate suite.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Probably, all we got is blonde, thirties, lives in Brooklyn. So we fed her descriptors in the DMV database and got it narrowed down to two women. Jolene Granger and Jolene Anders.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, you guys take Jolene Anders, we’ll take Granger, you call me when you get her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Roger that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jolene Granger, NYPD. Jolene.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Esposito.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jolene Granger is dead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re on our way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Esposito, Esposito.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what have you got?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: What you heard was a flash bang. Lockwood must have grabbed them. Only thing we’ve recovered so far are the cell phones.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He dumped both of their phones so we can’t GPS track them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We couldn’t find Jolene’s cell phone either. Lockwood must have gotten rid of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because her phone was a link to him, she’d call him on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s got to be a cell phone bill around here somewhere.

utterance.speaker: HAL LOCKWOOD
utterance.content: I wanna congratulate you both. I don’t know how you found my place, but I’ve been doing this kind of work for a while now, and no one's ever come that close to me. But my problem is that your investigation has gone further than I expected. And now in order for me to finish my job, I need to know exactly what you know about me and my employer. Now I’ve got a lot of respect for you guys, what you do. Now I’m gonna make you a deal. You tell me what I need to know, one pro to another, and I will put a bullet in your brain. You don’t and you jerk me around, and you will be begging me to before this night is up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m gonna have to go with option B.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh yeah, we’re definitely gonna jerk you around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s her account number?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fifty eight ninety two, sixty three nine, eleven ninety nine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, if we can figure out her mother’s maiden name they’ll email us the password.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I need everything you can get on Jolene Granger, specifically her mother’s maiden name.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Listen, assclown, I was in Catholic school for twelve years. Hell, they used to do this to me for talking in class.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re dead, Lockwood.

utterance.speaker: LOCKWOOD
utterance.content: Yeah, you know, they always start off with bravado. The begging comes later. See, this is ice cold water, it’ll burn like hell when it hits his lungs and he won’t lose consciousness right away, but all this stops when you tell me how much the cops know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lockwood would have been one of the last numbers she called.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Got it, ah. Nine one seven five five five oh one seven six, I need a GPS…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Castle, you’ve done it again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That guy's gonna spot a SWAT team from a block away, warn Lockwood. We call in the cavalry and they are both dead. I’m open to dumb ideas here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good, cause I got one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s not buying it, Castle...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was amazing… The way you knocked him out, I mean… it was…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let's go, yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Don’t tell this jackhole anything.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m sorry, bro, I can’t watch this. Listen to me, you’re too late. The cops already know all about ... me and your mom.

utterance.speaker: LOCKWOOD
utterance.content: Shoot out one of his kneecaps.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You OK?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Huh? Never better.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey there, Chuck Norris. How’s the hand?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, excruciating.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmmmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How’s Ryan and Esposito?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmmm mild hypothermia, wounded pride. Guess which one will heal first? Thank you, for having my back in there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Always.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We booked you as John Doe; you sure as hell aren’t Hal Lockwood. Who hired you? I put a lot of people in this place. Some of them want to kill me, others never been treated so fairly in their lives. So they form this attachment to me, it’s like I’m their favourite school teacher. Some of those people might visit you while you’re in here, like the ghosts that visit Scrooge. And after some time with them, you might find yourself a changed man. So I will be back here, week after week, to ask you who hired you til that miracle occurs.
